text.section:
Where the contract requires payment before inspection nonconformity of the goods does not excuse the buyer from so making payment unless:
The nonconformity appears without inspection; or
Despite tender of the required documents the circumstances would justify injunction against honor under this chapter (KRS 355.5-109(2)).
Payment pursuant to subsection (1) of this section does not constitute an acceptance of goods or impair the buyer's right to inspect or any of his remedies.

law.history: Amended 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 408, sec. 20, effective July 1, 2001. -- Created 1958 Ky. Acts ch. 77, sec. 2-512, effective July 1, 1960.
